issue.title: Sudden drop in points
issue.body:
First of all: thank you for this awesome service. It motivates me to contribute to opensource projects.

I used to have ~20 points, and all of a sudden it dropped to 9 points. If I manually count the yellow squares in the activities menu, I get to 21 (probably my old score). Does this mean that some contibutions don't count anymore? Thanks a lot!

repo.name: code-curiosity

pull_request.title: Fixed bug: Point calculation is wrong.
pull_request.body:
refs #172
1) Added validations to activity model.
2) Added task to retrieve data for missing fields.
3) Updated factories and related tests.
Run **bundle exec rake utils:update_activities_event_action RAILS_ENV=production --trace** to update old activities.

Note: As per discussion with Github support, details of a particular activity cannot be retrieved. Hence the only way is to retrieve all the activities for a user is as done [here](https://github.com/joshsoftware/code-curiosity/blob/master/app/models/activities_fetcher.rb#L19) and filter the required activities. Also, it might not retrieve all activities as in this [issue](https://github.com/piotrmurach/github/issues/286) and hence the point calculation is still going to be a bit wrong.

First of all: thank you for this awesome service. It motivates me to contribute to opensource projects.

I used to have ~20 points, and all of a sudden it dropped to 9 points. If I manually count the yellow squares in the activities menu, I get to 21 (probably my old score). Does this mean that some contibutions don't count anymore? Thanks a lot!

issue.title: User#refresh_gh_client raises ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::InvalidSignature
issue.body:
The method [User#refresh_gh_client](https://github.com/joshsoftware/code-curiosity/blob/master/app/models/concerns/user_github_helper.rb#L18) sometimes raises **ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::InvalidSignature** exception though not consistently. This is  because the [user's](https://github.com/joshsoftware/code-curiosity/blob/master/app/models/concerns/user_github_helper.rb#L19) auth_token is invalid and cannot be verified as done [here](https://github.com/joshsoftware/code-curiosity/blob/master/app/models/concerns/user_github_helper.rb#L20). This can be fixed as
1) getting a user with valid auth_token

```ruby
def refresh_gh_client                                                                                                           
  auth_tk = nil                                                                                                                 
  begin                                                                                                                         
    u = User.where(:auth_token.ne => nil).all.sample                                                                            
    auth_tk = User.encrypter.decrypt_and_verify(u.auth_token)                                                                   
  rescue ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::InvalidSignature
    u.set({auth_token: nil})                                                              
    retry                                                                                                                       
  end                                                                                                                           
  @gh_client = Github.new({                                                                                                     
  oauth_token: auth_tk,                                                                                                       
    client_id: ENV['GIT_APP_ID'],                                                                                               
    client_secret: ENV['GIT_APP_SECRET']                                                                                        
  })                                                                                                                            
end
```
2) Refreshing the current user's auth_token.
Ideas?

issue.title: Missing auto_pagination in ActivitiesFetcher & CommitsFetcher.
issue.body: We are fetching only the first 200 records by specifying the **per_page** option in the ActivitiesFetcher and CommitsFetcher. We need to specify the **auto_pagination** option since we aren't paginating manually either.

pull_request.title: Fixed bug: Point calculation is wrong.
pull_request.body:
refs #172
1) Added validations to activity model.
2) Added task to retrieve data for missing fields.
3) Updated factories and related tests.
Run **bundle exec rake utils:update_activities_event_action RAILS_ENV=production --trace** to update old activities.

Note: As per discussion with Github support, details of a particular activity cannot be retrieved. Hence the only way is to retrieve all the activities for a user is as done [here](https://github.com/joshsoftware/code-curiosity/blob/master/app/models/activities_fetcher.rb#L19) and filter the required activities. Also, it might not retrieve all activities as in this [issue](https://github.com/piotrmurach/github/issues/286) and hence the point calculation is still going to be a bit wrong.

issue.title: Status: "In review" for commits from a long time
issue.body:
I don't know whether this is the appropriate place for this type of queries. So pardon me if it isn't and redirect me to the right place.  Anyway, I really like the concept of code curiosity and it has given me the motivation to contribute to the open source.
I have made several commits this month.But most of them are still showing the status "In review" from a very long time(some commits were made almost 10 days ago) and no points have been awarded on them. Also some commits fetch no points which is a little disheartening considering they also required some effort to make.

Here is the screenshot showing the status
![screenshot from 2016-10-16 15-41-09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8847265/19416794/5c148a18-93b7-11e6-8b56-a8b064bc7f8a.png)

I kindly request someone to please look into this issue. I would also love to know the scoring logic and how points are distributed to the various commits. Thanks for your time.

issue.title: Rewarded Issue close activity.
issue.body:
For eg. Issue [derrek/street-address#35](https://github.com/derrek/street-address/issues/35) which I had opened on 23 Aug was rewarded that time. 
Thats correct, But when I closed this Issue its rewarded again :flushed: 
Is this behavior correct?
Thoughts?
